title: JSON-Schema for SpecIF v1.1
description: The Specification Integration Facility (SpecIF) integrates partial system models from different methods and tools in a semantic net. Collaborators shall browse, search and audit engineering results in a common context. Also, the exchange of model information between organizations and tools is facilitated. SpecIF represents the visible, i.e. the diagrams and the text, as well as the semantics of system specifications.

revision.description: A globally unique revision tag with one or multiple blocks with alphanumeric characters separated by a special character [.:,;/-]. Sequential as well as branching/merging notations are possible.

replaces.description: For change and configuration management; the first revision has 0 entries, a simple modification has 1 entry and the result of a merge has 2 entries.

key.description: A key for a particular revision of an identifiable item, e.g. of a resource. A key consists of a globally unique identifier and a revision. No or an undefined revision means the latest revision of the identified item.

revision.description: If missing, the latest revision is implied.

alternativeIds.description: The list of consolidated items which can be used in case a consolidated item shall be updated.

items.description: A list of pointers to resources resp. statements which have been merged to this one.

id.description: A string with a valid identifier of a model-element

revision.description: If missing, the latest revision is implied.

project.description: A string with a valid project identifier

dateTime.description: An ISO-8601 dateTime string. For reduced accuracy, any number of values may be dropped, but only from right to left.

icon.description: A symbol for display as a prefix to titles; applicable to all instances of the class. Is usually a XML-encoded UTF-8 symbol, can be an URL or dataURL.

instantiation.description: Indicates whether an instance of the class is created automatically, manually or both. All is allowed, if the property is omitted. The class is abstract and cannot be instantiated, if the property list is present, but empty.

multilanguageText.description: A list of items with text and language properties. If the information is be provided in multiple languages, the language must be specified for proper selection; it is however not required by the schema to avoid a lot of overhead in most cases with a single language.

format.description: By default, the format is assumed 'plain'.

language.description: An IETF language tag such as 'en', 'en-US, 'fr' or 'de'.

values.description: If 'multiple' of the propertyClass is undefined or false, the array must contain one item. If the value is unknown, omit the whole property. By default, the class' value applies.

oneOf.description: For properties with a dataType other than 'xs:string'.

nodes.description: A list of pointers to resources; may be nested forming a tree, i.e. a hierarchy of pointers.

title.description: The node's label; if missing, the title of the referenced resource is applied.

resource.description: The pointer to the resource to be displayed at this position.

propertyClasses.description: A list of keys pointing to a member of propertyClasses.

properties.description: A list of properties of a resource or statement.

title.description: The property's label; if missing, the title of the property's class is applied.

class.description: Must be a member of propertyClasses. In addition, it must be listed in the propertyClasses of the parent's class.

$schema.description: An absolute URL pointing to this SpecIF schema.

isExtension.description: Indicates that the project is not schema-compliant on its own; by default the value is 'false'. Of course, it is expected that once extended the project is schema-compliant.

createdBy.description: The creator of the SpecIF data-set (file). If specified, at least an e-mail address must be given.

language.description: An IETF language tag such as 'en', 'en-US, 'fr' or 'de' showing the used language of the project. Is superseded by a resource's, statement's or property's language value.

dataTypes.description: The base data types for use by property class definitions.

type.description: The corresponding definition in https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/ applies.
type.title: Data-type 'Boolean', 'dateTime' or 'URI'

type.description: The corresponding definition in https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/ applies.
type.title: Data-type 'Integer'

type.description: The corresponding definition in https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/ applies.
type.title: Data-type 'Double'

fractionDigits.description: Optional use by dataType 'xs:double', indicates the number of decimals.
fractionDigits.title: Number of fraction digits of a Decimal Number

type.description: The corresponding definition in https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/ applies.
type.title: Data-type 'String' with plain or formatted text. The property's text object MAY specify the format and language.

type.description: The corresponding definition in https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/ applies.
type.title: Data-type 'Enumeration'

values.description: Mandatory use by dataType 'xs:enumeration'. If 'multiple' is true 0..n options may be selected, otherwise exactly one must be selected.
values.title: Enumerated Values

multiple.description: Optional use by dataType 'xs:enumeration'. Indicates whether multiple values can be chosen; by default the value is 'false'.

propertyClasses.description: Class definition of a property for resources or statements. Is a sub-element of the respective resourceClass or statementClass. If no revision or change information is specified, the respective values of the parent element apply.

dataType.description: Must be a member of dataTypes.

multiple.description: Optional use by all propertyClasses. Indicates whether multiple values can be given. If omitted, the 'multiple' property of the dataType applies; by default the value is 'false'.

values.description: An optional list of default values in case the instantiated resource's or statement's property is missing.

unit.description: The unit of the numeric value given; preferrably an SI unit symbol such as 'm^3/kg' (Système international (d'unités)) or a currency symbol.

extends.description: Must be a member of resourceClasses.

statementClasses.description: The class definitions for statements in subject-predicate-object statements, where subject and object are resources.

extends.description: Must be a member of statementClasses.

isUndirected.description: Indicates that an instance's subject and object are equivalent and can be exchanged without changing its meaning. Is superseded by a statement's definition.

subjectClasses.description: A collection of id's of eligible resource and statement classes; if 'subjectClasses' is missing, all resource or statement classes are eligible.
subjectClasses.title: Resource and statement classes eligible as subject

items.description: Must be a member of resourceClasses or statementClasses.

objectClasses.description: A collection of id's of eligible resource and statement classes; if 'objectClasses' is missing, all resource or statement classes are eligible.
objectClasses.title: Resource and statement classes eligible as object

items.description: Must be a member of resourceClasses or statementClasses.

resources.description: The resources such as diagrams, model elements or requirements.

class.description: Must be a member of resourceClasses.

language.description: An IETF language tag such as 'en', 'en-US, 'fr' or 'de' showing the used language of the resource. Is superseded by a property's language value.

statements.description: Subject-predicate-Object statements, where subject and object are resources. In other terms, statements are directed relations between two resources building a semantic net.

class.description: Must be a member of statementClasses.

subject.description: Must be a member of resources or statements.

object.description: Must be a member of resources or statements.

language.description: An IETF language tag such as 'en', 'en-US, 'fr' or 'de' showing the used language of the statement. Is superseded by a property's language value.

hierarchies.description: A list of hierarchies with pointers to resources; may be nested to build a tree, i.e. a hierarchy of pointers.

files.description: A list of files being referenced by a resource's or statement's property of dataType XHTML using an <object> tag. A file should have a media type as defined by IANA (see below).

title.description: In case of a file, the title is the absolute or relative URL.

type.description: The file's media type (formerly MIME-type) according to https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml.
